1.text: You, my child, be strengthened in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.

2.text: What you heard from me among many witnesses, entrust likewise to faithful men who will be able to teach others as well.

3.text: You too must endure tribulations as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.

4.text: No soldier on duty entangles himself in the affairs of this life, in order to please the one who enrolled him as a soldier.

5.text: Likewise, anyone who competes in athletics cannot be crowned unless he has competed by the rules.

6.text: The farmer who labors must be the first to get a share of the crops.

7.text: Think over what I have said, and may the Lord give you understanding in all things.

8.text: Remember my Good News: Jesus Christ, risen from the dead, of the seed of David.

9.text: Because of this I suffer tribulations to the point of being in chains as a criminal. However, God’s word is not chained!

10.text: Therefore, I endure all things for the sake of the elect, so that they may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus and with it eternal glory.

11.text: This saying is sure:  For if we died with him, we will also live with him.

12.text: If we endure, we will also reign with him.   If we deny him, he also will deny us.

13.text: If we are faithless, he remains faithful;   He cannot deny himself.

14.text: Remind the people of these things, warning them in the sight of the Lord that they should not argue about words: this profits nothing and it brings ruin to those who listen.

15.text: Work hard to present yourself as approved by God, as a worker who does not need to be ashamed, rightly handling the word of truth.

16.text: Stay away from godless empty discussions because those involved in it will become more and more ungodly.

17.text: Their word will consume like gangrene! Some of them are Hymenaeus and Philetus;

18.text: they are in error concerning the truth, saying that the resurrection is already past and they bring some people’s faith to ruin

19.text: However, God’s firm foundation stands, having this seal, “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let every one who calls upon the Name of the Lord depart from unrighteousness.”

20.text: Now in a large house, there are not only vessels of gold and silver, but also of wood and clay. Some are for an honorable use and some for a dishonorable use.

21.text: Therefore, if anyone purges himself from these things, he will be a vessel for honor, sanctified and suitable for the master’s use, prepared for every good work.

22.text: Flee from youthful lusts! Pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord from a pure heart.

23.text: Reject foolish and ignorant questionings because you know that they result in conflict.

24.text: The Lord’s servant must not be argumentative but gentle to all, able to teach, and patient!

25.text: In gentleness, he should correct those who oppose him: perhaps God will give them the repentance that leads to a full knowledge of the truth.

26.text: Thus, they may return to their senses and escape the snare of the devil (who had taken them captive to do his will).
